page.title: 15Breamore's Past 2
page.content: surplus wool for sale,and constructed the mill for their own and the villager's use. Breamore was not spared the religious upheavals of the 16th c. The{Priory was dissolved in the summer of 1536. In 1577,the{Doddingtons}bought the Priory,and shortly thereafter built Breamore House. Ownership of the estate passed to the {Hulse}family in 1748,and they helped to develop enclosures and increase food production. The number of villagers grew,with many of them now forced to find wage employment on the estate or in nearby Fordingbridge. Poverty was a problem and by 1851, nearly 10% of the population were living in parish houses.A Church school was set up in 1830 in a cottage on the marsh,and the present village school was built in 1872.
